trans-unit.source: Upgrades a database that was created using an earlier version of to the current version of , then connects to it. If the database does not exist, an error appears in the error log and the connection attempt fails with an SQLException indicating that the database cannot be found.

seg-source.mrk: Upgrades a database that was created using an earlier version of <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> to the current version of <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>, then connects to it.
If the database does not exist, an error appears in the error log and the connection attempt fails with an SQLException indicating that the database cannot be found.

target.mrk: Upgrades a database that was created using an earlier version of <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> to the current version of <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>, then connects to it.
If the database does not exist, an error appears in the error log and the connection attempt fails with an SQLException indicating that the database cannot be found.

trans-unit.source: This operation performs a full upgrade, as defined in "Upgrading a database" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>. For more information about upgrades, see the other topics under "Upgrades" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: This operation performs a full upgrade, as defined in "Upgrading a database" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.
For more information about upgrades, see the other topics under "Upgrades" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

target.mrk: This operation performs a full upgrade, as defined in "Upgrading a database" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.
For more information about upgrades, see the other topics under "Upgrades" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

trans-unit.source: For a database for which authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> can perform a full upgrade. See also "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: For a database for which authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> can perform a full upgrade.
See also "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.

target.mrk: For a database for which authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> can perform a full upgrade.
See also "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Note: You cannot perform a full upgrade on a database already booted in soft upgrade mode. If a database is already booted in soft upgrade mode, the upgrade=true attribute will have no effect. If a database is already booted in soft upgrade mode, you can first shutdown the database with the shutdown=true attribute and then connect with upgrade=true to perform the upgrade.

seg-source.mrk: Note: You cannot perform a full upgrade on a database already booted in soft upgrade mode.
If a database is already booted in soft upgrade mode, the upgrade=true attribute will have no effect.
If a database is already booted in soft upgrade mode, you can first shutdown the database with the shutdown=true attribute and then connect with upgrade=true to perform the upgrade.

target.mrk: Note: You cannot perform a full upgrade on a database already booted in soft upgrade mode.
If a database is already booted in soft upgrade mode, the upgrade=true attribute will have no effect.
If a database is already booted in soft upgrade mode, you can first shutdown the database with the shutdown=true attribute and then connect with upgrade=true to perform the upgrade.

trans-unit.source: You must specify a databaseName (after the subprotocol in the database connection URL) or a databaseName=nameofDatabase attribute with this attribute.

seg-source.mrk: You must specify a databaseName (after the subprotocol in the database connection URL) or a databaseName=nameofDatabase attribute with this attribute.

target.mrk: You must specify a databaseName (after the subprotocol in the database connection URL) or a databaseName=nameofDatabase attribute with this attribute.

trans-unit.source: You cannot combine this attribute with the collation or territory=ll_CC attributes.

seg-source.mrk: You cannot combine this attribute with the collation or territory=ll_CC attributes.

target.mrk: You cannot combine this attribute with the collation or territory=ll_CC attributes.
